title.narrative: Women and girls who have experienced/are experiencing GBV or are at risk of GBV benefit from provision of and access to quality services and empowered to increasingly engage in decision making and leadership in GBV response, mitigation and prevention.

description.narrative:
This objective of this UN Women multi-country programme is to provide survivors of GBV and those at risk of GBV with livelihoods and agency to facilitate their access to lifesaving humanitarian services and facilitate their voices in promoting GBV accountability in humanitarian contexts. The impact of the programme will be to more effectively mitigate, prevent and respond to GBV amongst crisis affected communities. UN Women interventions focus on three outcomes, two of them to be jointly achieved with UNFPA. The three key outcomes of the project cover aspects of social norm programming that will contribute to protection and empowerment of crisis affected women and girls in priority countries; scaling up partnerships with local WLOs/WROs and strengthening their capacities to participate in humanitarian decision making; increasing access and improving quality of services provided to crisis affected women and girls (refugees, IDPs and in host communities) both in relation to protection and livelihoods/income generation (including cash for women). The program will also contribute to the protection and address the needs and priorities of at risk and marginalized groups including LGBTIQ+ populations, women and girls with disabilities.
The project is designed to be sustainable and continue yielding positive impact after the implementation period concludes.
This $8mil project targets 176,610 affected people with Protection/GBV engagement, 5,684 with Food Security and 732 affected people with specific multi-sector cash assistance modalities.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: WLOs and WROs are empowered to increasingly engage in decision making and leadership in GBV response, mitigation and prevention (OUTCOME-JOINT).
Percentage of targeted WLOs/WROs that report increased capacity to implement GBV risk mitigation, prevention and response interventions. (OUTCOME-JOINT)
Percentage of targeted WLOs/WROs that report increased involvement/participation in humanitarian decision-making. (OUTCOME-JOINT)
Women and girls who have experienced/are experiencing GBV or are at risk of GBV benefit from provision of and access to quality, multi-sectoral services, including legal aid (OUTCOME-SPECIFIC)
Number of targeted GBV survivors (women and girls at risk) who have access to GBV information, legal advice/assistance, psychosocial support and referrals. (OUTCOME – SPECIFIC)
Number of targeted GBV survivors (women and girls at risk) who report that GBV services were delivered according to their needs and priorities. (OUTCOME – SPECIFIC)
Reduced risk of GBV through provision of livelihoods opportunities, cash transfers including cash for work (OUTCOME-SPECIFIC)

Percentage of targeted GBV survivors and women at risk who report increased control over financial resources following their participation in livelihood interventions, including cash for work. (OUTCOME-SPECIFIC)
Percentage of targeted women at risk who report sole or joint decision in household decision making as result of livelihood interventions. (OUTCOME-SPECIFIC)
Increase in number of GBV survivors/at risk women and girls accessing livelihoods opportunities to mitigate GBV (protection) risks.

Representatives of community-based mechanisms, including protection networks and women’s groups have increased capacities to design, implement and monitor protection and GBV prevention strategies and initiatives (OUTPUT)
Number of community protection groups reporting on increased capacities to address GBV as result of UN Women supported training.
Number of WLOs/WROs equipped with increased knowledge and skills to identify GBV risks and lead community level GBV mitigation strategies, referral pathways and protection mechanisms.
WLOs/WROs and representatives of self-organized women’s groups have enhanced leadership skills to engage in humanitarian decision making (OUTPUT)
Number of targeted WLOs/WROs that report increased access to tools and resources in cluster and inter-cluster humanitarian planning and response processes and mechanisms (OUTPUT SPECIFIC).

Number of WLOs/WROs and representatives of women’s organizations and networks that report on strengthened leadership skills, increased capacities and knowledge to engage in humanitarian decision making processes
Availability of GBV multi-sectoral service delivery, capacities and information services through protection centers, empowerment hubs and technology/remote options OUTPUT

Number of WLO/WRO staff members engaging in service provision that report on strengthened capacities to respond to GBV cases and provide services to GBV survivors as per international standards and no-harm principles
Number of GBV survivors supported by psychosocial support services, case management and orientation through referral pathways and remote/technology-based solutions.
GBV survivors and at-risk populations have increased access to short-term vocational training and temporary cash for work opportunities (OUTPUT).

Number of survivors and at-risk populations reporting on increased control over financial resources following their participation in livelihood interventions, including cash for work. (OUTPUT-SPECIFIC)
Beneficiaries, through program interventions, demonstrate changes in attitudes and beliefs towards social norms that perpetuate GBV and gender inequalities (OUTCOME-JOINT)

Percentage of women, men, girls and boys who report that they disagree or strongly disagree with locally relevant harmful social norms (e.g., victim-blaming attitudes, discriminatory attitudes towards survivors). (OUTCOME-JOINT)
